bibl.title: The Archive of the Praktor Milon.

series.title: Koninklijke Vlaamse Academie van België voor Wetenschappen en Kunsten. Vlaamse Kennis- en Cultuurforum

bibl.note: 32 texts, 10 demotic and 22 Greek, dealing with Edfu. Most are directed to Milon, commissioner of the temples, 225-222 B.C. - Pp. 24-26: Appendix 1. A chronological survey of the texts; - 27: Appendix 2. The Milon Archive in its historical context.

bibl.title: Edfu, an Egyptian Provincial Capital in the Ptolemaic Period. Brussels, 3 September 2001

bibl.seg: 145.12 / 145.4 P. Bürgsch P. Eleph. Dem. 145.4 P. Eleph. 146
CLARYSSE Willy, The Archive of the Praktor Milon.

Katelijn VANDORPE and Willy CLARYSSE (Edd.), Edfu, an Egyptian Provincial Capital in the Ptolemaic Period. Brussels, 3 September 2001 = Koninklijke Vlaamse Academie van België voor Wetenschappen en Kunsten. Vlaamse Kennis- en Cultuurforum (Brussel, 2003) pp. 17-27.

32 texts, 10 demotic and 22 Greek, dealing with Edfu. Most are directed to Milon, commissioner of the temples, 225-222 B.C. - Pp. 24-26: Appendix 1. A chronological survey of the texts; - 27: Appendix 2. The Milon Archive in its historical context.
